fields.Title of Presentation: "The Innkeeper's Wife: Jewish Working Women in Poland-Lithuania during the 18th Century"
fields.Conference/Meeting Name: Polish Institute of Arts and Sciences of America 8th World Congress
fields.Sponsoring Organization: Polish Institute of Arts and Sciences in America and Polish Academy of Sciences Joint Conference sponsored by the University of Bialystok
fields.Description/Abstract: This paper address the multiethnic and contested nature of borderlands, realms where the mixing of populations and cultures have occurred, such as the Inn.  The Inn has been a zone of peaceful coexistence and brutalizing violence. At the same time, it is a place of national indifference and identity-formation. The Inn was the center of the shtetl, and it  inspired outstanding literary works and other cultural products, both national and transnational. But what was the role of the Innkeeper's wife at the center of that Inn?
